column2: evelyn, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: i have taken this medication for several years now.  it seems to be less effective. I asked my rhumatologist to increase the dose--he did but now that doesn't help either,  i am afraid of the long term use of this medication .  many days I hurt over my entire body and I am stiff ALL Day LONG.

column2: eloize, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Prescribed 3 years ago, then I read an Oxford study (that doc hadn't)stating 72% increase in risk of heart attack and stroke, and I discontinued. Only now word getting out better about danger.

column1: Osteoarthritis with High Risk of Developing Ulcers
column2: Janet Young, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have used this medicine for my arthritis for years and have found it to be effective.  My prescription is written for two a day, but I try to get by on one a day, if I can.  This medicine does not bother my stomach as others have, which I have tried.

column1: Osteoarthritis with High Risk of Developing Ulcers
column2: fgreene, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Many years of use has resulted in no side effects and I can really tell if I forget to take it.

column2: rosered, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Don't be surprised if it causes bloody stools. I took it for about 3 weeks and then it happened and scared the daylights out of me! I did take it with food, but ended up going back to Celebrex. Had to take omneprazole for a week after the episode with the bleeding. It was effective for osteoarthritis pain, but no different from taking Celebrex, which is easier on your stomach. Never again for me.

column1: Osteoarthritis with High Risk of Developing Ulcers
column2: 4blackwids, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I've used Diclofenac for approx. 9yrs now & have found it to be a very effective anti-inflammatory for my OA. I've had no problems w/side effects. After trying several other NSAIDS, this one has worked best for me. In fact, stopping it before surgeries nearly cripples me w/pain.
